alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Highlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 4:10PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Okanogan County through 500 PM PDT... At 410 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles east of Oroville, or 41 miles northeast of Omak, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Molson, Chesaw and Sitzmark Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
